main event: A round silver disc was observed moving at 50-70 mph over Santa Rosa, California, three times over a two-hour period, with each observation lasting approximately 5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was first sighted at 1315 PDT and observed again at 1422 PDT and 1515 PDT,The object was tracked on radar for 15 minutes,It was estimated to be flying at an altitude of 12,000 feet,The observed object maneuvered rapidly, making a series of right-angle turns,The object was described as round, bright, and luminous, approximately 12 to 15 feet in diameter.
